title: Phrasal Verbs With Stand, Turn, And Set

exercises.title: Phrasal Verbs With Turn, Stand, And Set

questions.question: The factory turns …………………. hundreds of bicycles every day.
questions.description: To turn out is to produce.

questions.question: I did go to their place but they turned me ………………
questions.description: To turn somebody away is to refuse to allow them to enter a place.

questions.question: They turned …………………. our offer.
questions.description: To turn something down is to reject it.

questions.question: Her arrogance turned me ………………..
questions.description: To turn someone off is to make them feel bored or disgusted.

questions.question: I had invited all of my friends but none of them turned .....................
questions.description: To turn up is to put in an appearance.

questions.question: He turned ………………. to be a traitor.
questions.description: If something turns out, it proves to be the case.

questions.question: The dog turned ………………. the visitor without any provocation.
questions.description: To turn on is to attack.

questions.question: We shall be invincible if we stand ………………… one another.
questions.description: To stand by someone is to support them.

questions.question: We must have the courage to stand …………………. for our rights.
questions.description: To stand up for something is to act in support of it.

questions.question: The High court set ………………….. the decree of the lower court.
questions.description: To set something aside is to annul a legal decision.

questions.question: He immediately set ...................... building a business.
questions.description: To set about is to start doing something with determination.

questions.question: We set ……………….. in the morning.
questions.description: To set off is to begin a journey.
